Posts.Content: Jul 30, 2010 08:33AM - edited Jul 30, 2010 08:35AM by DebbiD Thank you for you IsThisForReal for bumping me to Collette and Binney!  I've learned a lot by looking at the Lymphodema site and maybe should get the opinion of a lymphodema expert instead of relying on my amateur analysis. The fluid in my breast is still "drainable".  Maybe I should have it aspirated again and see if it will stop accumulating. I'll call my surgeon today and see what he thinks.   Thanks again. Debbi
Posts.Title: Does anyone have a "fluib"? willy2351 worldwatcher

Posts.Content: Oct 10, 2009 02:57PM DebbiD wrote: Thank you so much  for your info,ladies.
Posts.Title: B-40 Trial Avastin DebbiD DebbiD

Posts.Content: DebbiD wrote: I have signed on to the B-40 clinical trial and have been selected to be in the Avastin group.  This means I will have four cycles of T plus Avastin, followed by two cycles of AC and Avastin, followed by two cycles of just AC, followed by surgery, followed by radiation, followed by 10 cycles of Avastin). Treatment begins next week.   Is anyone else in this trial? Do you know someone who is?  My husband and I have done a lot of research and know Avastin is controversial. We would like to hear from someone's personal experience, if possible, about how things have gone for you.  Thanks much! Debbi ...Standing on the Rock! Dx 8/27/2009, DCIS, 2cm, Stage IIIA, Grade 3, 4/7 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: B-40 Trial Avastin DebbiD DebbiD
